observations.content: The knowledge persistence pattern uses a graph database (Graphology + LevelDB) for knowledge storage.
The GraphDatabaseService component is responsible for interacting with the graph database.
The GraphKnowledgeExporter component is responsible for auto-exporting JSON data from the graph database.
The knowledge persistence pattern involves auto-syncing JSON data from the graph database to the .data/knowledge-export directory.
The knowledge persistence pattern provides a scalable and maintainable solution for knowledge storage and retrieval.
The knowledge persistence pattern uses environment variables (e.g., .env.ports) to configure component interactions.
The knowledge persistence pattern involves multiple components, including GraphDatabaseService, GraphKnowledgeExporter, and PersistenceAgent.
The PersistenceAgent component is responsible for persisting knowledge data to the graph database.
The knowledge persistence pattern involves triggering auto-exporting of JSON data using entity events (e.g., entity:stored).
The knowledge persistence pattern provides a flexible and scalable solution for knowledge management and analysis.
The knowledge persistence pattern uses a unified storage solution (e.g., graph database) to simplify data storage and retrieval.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/KnowledgePersistencePattern.md

The UkbCli knowledge entity is implemented across src/knowledge-management, lib/ukb-unified, and integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src directories.
The GraphDatabaseService and GraphKnowledgeExporter components are used for knowledge storage and export, respectively.
The use of Graphology and LevelDB for knowledge storage provides a robust and efficient data management system.
The vkb command can be used for visualization, while the graph-sync command can be used for synchronizing knowledge exports.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/UkbCli.md
The VkbCli implements a dual-storage architecture with Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph for primary storage and auto-synchronized JSON exports at .data/knowledge-export.
The GraphDatabaseService component is responsible for business logic, while the GraphDatabaseAdapter component provides data access abstraction.
The VkbCli uses the vkb command for visualization and MCP tools for knowledge operations, ensuring that data is properly validated and sanitized before being stored or exported.
The use of Graphology + LevelDB for data storage provides good performance and security, while the auto-synchronization of JSON exports ensures that data is up-to-date and consistent.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/VkbCli.md

ConfigurationPattern implements a multi-layered architecture with GraphDatabaseService and GraphKnowledgeExporter at .data/knowledge-graph using Graphology + LevelDB storage
Pattern spans three main directories: src/knowledge-management, lib/ukb-unified, and integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src with VkbApiClient and PersistenceAgent components
Knowledge operations use vkb command for visualization, coding command for development tasks, and graph-sync for database synchronization workflows
Configuration validation occurs through environment variables managed via .env.ports file, replacing deprecated shared-memory.json approach
Auto-synchronized JSON exports at .data/knowledge-export provide interoperability while GraphDatabaseAdapter ensures consistent data access patterns
Recent commits show active maintenance with fixes for memgraph MCP server port configuration and git submodule integration issues
MCP server integration uses proper git submodules for code-graph-rag functionality with resolved race condition handling in status operations
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/ConfigurationPattern.md

CollectiveKnowledge utilizes a hybrid storage architecture, combining Graphology and LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph for primary storage, with automated JSON exports synchronized to .data/knowledge-export for external access

Knowledge management operations are supported by GraphDatabaseService, GraphKnowledgeExporter, GraphDatabaseAdapter, PersistenceAgent, and VkbApiClient components, distributed across src/knowledge-management and lib/ukb-unified directories
The system uses specific commands, such as vkb for visualization and MCP tools for knowledge operations, to manage and interact with the knowledge graph, with graph-sync used for data synchronization

observations.content: The knowledge graph database is stored at .data/knowledge-graph using Graphology and LevelDB.
The DecoratorPattern is implemented across the src/knowledge-management and lib/ukb-unified directories.
The vkb command is used for visualization, and the MCP tools are used for knowledge operations.
The graph-sync command is used to auto-sync the graph database with the JSON exports at .data/knowledge-export.
The use of Graphology and LevelDB provides efficient storage and querying of the knowledge graph.
The knowledge graph database is accessed through the GraphDatabaseService and GraphDatabaseAdapter components.
The DecoratorPattern is used in the semantic analysis and knowledge management infrastructure, as part of the integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src directory.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/DecoratorPattern.md
The system uses Graphology + LevelDB at .data/knowledge-graph for primary graph storage, managed by existing components GraphDatabaseService, GraphDatabaseAdapter, and GraphKnowledgeExporter.
The system provides CLI access through the vkb command for visualization and the graph-sync command for synchronization.
Auto-synchronized JSON exports are maintained at .data/knowledge-export, removing dependency on the previously used shared-memory.json approach.
The system integrates with the MCP server at integrations/mcp-server-semantic-analysis/src, enabling knowledge operations.
The current architecture utilizes existing components and CLI commands, with a focus on graph storage and synchronization.
The system follows a microservices architecture, with separate components managing different aspects of the knowledge graph.
Detailed insight document available at: knowledge-management/insights/SemanticAnalysisAgentSystemImplementation.md
